content: colorama cowl by angeline webb of knitrelief designs finished measurements one size 30 circumference and 20 tall yarn 480 yards bulky weight sample shown in caron colorama halo perfect phasing 71% acrylic 18% nylon 11% polyester 481yds/227g in blue raspberry qty 1 needles 24 circular needles us 10 5 6 5 mm us 10 6 mm us 9 5 5 mm gauge 15 sts = 4 gauge is not crucial for this project however different gauge will result in different size and yardage requirements notions yarn needle colorama cowl is a super cozy and comfy split-hem cowl featuring a simple 2-row repeat this is a wonderful project for ombre yarns as soon as i saw this yarn i fell in love with the softness the colorway and the beautiful color transition aptly named perfect phasing cowl is worked flat from bottom edge towards neck edge is then sewn leaving a 6-8 vent check out the step-by-step video tutorial which includes a tip for using any weight yarn for this project colorama cowl © 2024 angeline webb 1 directions with us 10 5 6 5 mm needles co 115 sts row 1 sl 1 kw wyib k all sts row 2 sl 1 pw wyif *k1b p1 repeat from * to end repeat row 1 and 2 until cowl measures 8 from beginning change to us 10 6 mm needles continue repeating row 1 and 2 until cowl measures 14 from beginning change to us 9 5 5 mm needles continue repeating row 1 and 2 until cowl measures 20 from beginning work row 1 once bobble all sts on even row abbreviations with yarn needle sew edges together leaving a 6-8 vent at bottom bobble bind off co cast on weave in ends blocking is optional k knit k1b knit stitch in row below kw knitwise ndl needle p purl pw purlwise repeat repeat sl slip st s stitch es wyib with yarn in back wyif with yarn in front you might also like for pattern support contact knitreliefdesigns@gmail com colorama cowl © 2024 angeline webb 2
